isis.stitle: INSTRUMENTS (Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - RE 200 and RE 300 - OPERATION - FUEL LEVEL GAUGE

svcproc.title: FUEL LEVEL GAUGE
svcproc.para: The battery voltage is through the ignition switch relay (1711), circuit A13/A13F, fuse F22, circuit A28/A28B, the green instrument cluster (11), pin 10 to the fuel gauge. The level of fuel in the vehicle fuel tank is sensed by the fuel sending unit (37). The sending unit feeds an electrical voltage through circuit 36, pin A of connector (37), circuit N36, pin C6 of connector (2) and circuit A36, pin 3 of connector (11) to the fuel gauge, which displays the fuel level. The fuel sender (37) pin B is grounded through circuits N36-G/N11-GA/W11-GG to the (9000A) platform ground. The fuel gauge is grounded through pin 2 of connector (11) circuits A28-G/A11-GA to the (IPG) platform ground.
